message.content:
{"id": "41039", "title": "Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't perform the Find operation on Mac OS X", "description": "When using Eclipse 3.0 M2 (build id: 200307181617) on Mac OS X 10.2.6, the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog does not perform the Find operation. To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 
1) Open the Find/Replace dialog (Edit->Find/Replace).
2) Type a search term into the text box.
3) Press the Enter/Return key.

Expected Results: The Find operation should be performed, similar to clicking the 'Find' button which is highlighted as the default button in the Find/Replace dialog.

Actual Results: Nothing happens when the Enter/Return key is pressed.", "OB": "The Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog on Mac OS X 10.2.6 with Eclipse 3.0 M2 (build id: 200307181617) does not perform the Find operation when pressed.", "EB": "The Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog on Mac OS X 10.2.6 with Eclipse 3.0 M2 (build id: 200307181617) does not perform the Find operation when pressed.", "SR": "The issue should be fixed so that pressing the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog on Mac OS X 10.2.6 with Eclipse 3.0 M2 (build id: 200307181617) performs the Find operation as expected."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '41039', 'title': "Bug 41039Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't do anything on Mac OS X", 'description': "Bug 41039Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't do anything on Mac OS X ", 'OB': 'Eclipse 3.0 M2Build id: 200307181617Mac OS X 10.2.61) Open the Find/Replace dialog (EditFind/Replace).2) Type in a search term into the text box.3) Hit the return key.Nothing happens.Hitting the Return key should do a "Find" operation (thesame as clicking on the "Find" button, which is highlighted as the "default"button in the Find/Replace dialog). ', 'EB': 'Eclipse 3.0 M2Build id: 200307181617Mac OS X 10.2.61) Open the Find/Replace dialog (EditFind/Replace).2) Type in a search term into the text box.3) Hit the return key.Nothing happens.Hitting the Return key should do a "Find" operation (thesame as clicking on the "Find" button, which is highlighted as the "default"button in the Find/Replace dialog). ', 'SR': ''}
